intro: Hieracium nymphaeatiforme, commonly known as the water thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, showcasing its adaptability to moist environments. Its leaves are usually basal, rough, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are blue to purple in color. Hieracium nymphaeatiforme is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in areas with poor drainage.
